column2: >This one is a blend of a few simple ingredients to create the yummiest soup that is sure to satiate your family.

column3: >Beef roast cut in small cubes (beef tips and ribs will also work)
>Water as per requirement (if you like it thick and creamy, use less water)

column2: >Start by cooking the beef in the sauteed onion and tomato mixture. Deglaze the pan by adding some water and cook the beef on medium-high heat. Once it is tender, add the potatoes and spices. To make this dish more wholesome, you can serve it with some cornbread and ta-da!

column1: Courtesy: Quarantine Cooking and Survival via Facebook",publish,Food,Gallery,15 Sure-fire Recipes to Ace While in Quarantine,"With the world practicing social-isolation amid the COVID-19 pandemic, most of us have been urged to work from home. As it turns out, self-isolation is proving to be quite wearisome. There’s not much we can do within the confines of our homes, especially with the limited resources we have to feed ourselves. This whole ordeal, of course, is turning out to be quite the task for many. For those of us who are just bored with eating the same meal every day, here are some of the best recipes that’ll satisfy the tummy and soul.",Shutterstock,,,,

column2: >Who said a burrito and a casserole cannot be best friends? Check this one out for some fusion inspiration.

column3: >1 can cream of condensed mushroom soup

column4: >cook the onions and beef before adding the refried beans and taco seasoning.
column5: > Next, cook the soup, sour cream, and green chilies together
column6: >. Put half of the soup mix at the bottom of a casserole dish and top this with some tortillas, half of the ground beef mixture, corn, and a whole cup of cheese. Repeat each layer and finish it with cheese on the top. Bake this for 20 minutes until the cheese is utterly bubbly and delicious.

column2: >There’s nothing more scrumptious and heavenly than a dollop of nutella on a crispy rice cake.

column3: >Chocolate flavored rice cakes (as much as you want)
>Undying love for chocolate and rice cakes

column2: >Walk into the kitchen. Place the rice cakes on a plate and use a knife to spread generous amounts of nutella on them. Proceed to fit the entire cake in your mouth in one go. Munch munch and hmmm…!

column2: >Corn dog muffins are extremely moist, nummy, with a perfectly fluffy texture. These poppable bites are great for pretty much every occasion.
>Start by preheating the oven to a steady
column4: >. Mix the cornbread, eggs, sugar, milk, and cheese. Before you fill the muffin tray, ensure that you spray it with oil, butter, or ghee. Make sure that you are not adding too much batter or it’ll overflow while baking. If you’re using a mini-muffin tray, bake for 12-13 minutes, and if you’re using a large tray, then bake them for about 14-15 minutes.

column2: >Jambalaya makes for a flavorful and easy weeknight meal. A classic
column3: >Louisiana-origin dish, this recipe is loaded with rich flavors and spices.

column2: >Once your pot is hot, add the butter and cook the chicken and sausage to your liking. Throw in the celery and onion and sauté until soft. Add the garlic and cook for a minute. Now, add in the flavoring and stir well. Once the spices are nicely cooked, throw in the tomatoes, rice, and stocks. Stir to make sure that the rice is not clumpy. Now, set your pot to manual and let it cook for a decent 10 minutes. Let it cool off, and then bite in.

column2: >This soup is easy, creamy, fresh, heavenly, and perfect for a filling meal. A large stock of this will last you for days

>Step one is to make a stock of the leftover meat bones and scraps. Next, dice the potatoes, add them to the stock and let them simmer till they’re soft. Blend this mixture and add a full cup of heavy cream. For taste, add salt, black pepper, and a pinch of cayenne. For toppings, add chives or scallions or both.

column2: >If you’re bored with the aforementioned soups, then this one’s for you! This one is a rich blend of creamy potatoes, garlic, and lots of spice. If you’re the health-conscious kind, you can, of course, swap the potatoes with sweet potatoes.

>Start by sautéeing the chopped onion and garlic in ridiculous amounts of butter, and then add a tablespoon of curry paste. Once cooked, add the diced potatoes and simmer it in the stock of your choice. Lastly, add salt, and peppers. Don’t forget to throw in the cheese(cheddar works best)! Now, enjoy this delicious soup and thank us later!

column2: >Try this French bread if you’re looking for something new and miss eating fancy food.

>Preheat the oven while you mix the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt in a mixing bowl. Add all the wet ingredients and mix the dry and wet ingredients well. Add 4 oz of butter before you knead the dough and add 4 oz of butter again when you put the dough back into the mixing bowl. Once the dough is ready, cover it with plastic wrap and leave it for some time. Once it is nice and fluffy, cut it into three equal pieces and braid them into one piece. Brush on some egg wash before putting it into the oven at 490 F to get a beautiful brown color. Bake it for around half an hour, and after all this effort, enjoy the delicious bread!

>Eggs are beautiful things. They’re versatile and you can cook them in so many ways and more. To jazz up your breakfast routine, we added a twist to this omelet recipe.

>This omelet is by far one of the easiest recipes on this list. Sautee the garlic and add the mushrooms and spinach. Pour in the egg mixture on a preheated pan and keep stirring to ensure that it does not burn. Once the bottom cooks, add in a few pieces of butter and let it cook before rolling it onto your plate. Cut in the middle for maximum aesthetic and proceed to eat.

column2: >People on the Internet are going gaga over this coffee. Don’t forget to try this out. Oh, might we add, please be ready for a sore and throbbing hand by the time you’re done whipping the mixture.

>Add the coffee, sugar, water to a mixing bowl and beat the mixture like nobody’s business. Once you notice that it’s pale and frothy, add to a glass filled with cold. Voila! Your Dalgona coffee is ready!

column2: >If you’re bored of making elaborate dishes, this one’s for you!
column3: >Totchos are crunchy, delectable, and surprisingly full of flavor.
>1/2 cup of cooked and chopped chorizo or smoked sausage

column2: >Preheat the oven to 450 degrees and start by lining a large baking pan with parchment paper. Place the tots in a single layer and bake for about 20 minutes. Top this with bacon, sausage, and cheddar cheese and bake for an additional 5 minutes or till the cheese has melted. Remove this from the oven, add any toppings of your choice and serve hot.

column2: >When you’re pantry is running out of fresh foods, go back to the frozen foods tucked away in your freezer and whip up some delicious tacos!

column3: >1 package angel hair coleslaw, salted and sprinkled with lime juice

column2: >Heat the fish sticks and set them aside. Place the tortillas on a baking sheet and spray them with oil on both sides. Bake these for 3-4 minutes on each side and sprinkle the cabbage with lime juice and salt. Set this aside and throw in some cumin, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper into the sour cream. Now, assemble the tacos. Stuff your face with this tasty meal!

column2: >These absolutely delish meatball sliders will have you going back for seconds. They’re savory, flavorful, and filled cheese.

>As you preheat the oven to 350°F, put the buns on a dish. Spread the sauce on each bun, then place a meatball and cover it with mozzarella cheese. Brush these with olive oil. Mix the Parmesan cheese with the Italian seasoning for seasoning. Use a foil to cover the dish and bake it for 10 minutes. Remove the foil and bake it for another 10 minutes. That’s it!

column2: >If you’re up for making something extravagant but realize that your pantry is understocked, then this one’s for you.

>Start by preheating the oven to 350 degrees. Spray a baking dish with oil and heat a large skillet over medium heat. Then, throw in some ground beef and chopped onion. Cook till the beef crumbles. Add the marinara sauce and garlic and leave this mixture to simmer for about 5 minutes. As the sauce simmers, mix the ricotta, egg, Parmesan, parsley, garlic and onion powder in a small bowl. Spread out ⅓ of the meat mixture on the baking dish. Top this with a single layer of ravioli, ½ of the ricotta mixture, and  1/3 of the sauce. Repeat this for each layer. Sprinkle this with shredded mozzarella and cover it with a foil. Bake this for 40 minutes before removing the cover and baking it for 10 more minutes. Let the meal set for 10 minutes before serving.
